top_categories.workout_context: 86ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic's Gravel roads, Forest tracks forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 93 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
At mile 60 of 93, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic. Train it until it feels boring.
8,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
8,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 93 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
Low-cadence force work for 8,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on high country gravel and forest tracks. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic’s 93 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on high country gravel and forest tracks to build confidence. Expect: gravel roads, forest tracks, high country terrain.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Over Under, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 93 miles of high country gravel and forest tracks in Beechworth, Victoria.
